text3: A fully autonomous warning beacon. The beacon displays the signature of a major faction and it is likely that they will attack anyone that gets to close, no matter their standing.

text1: A defensive station for the outpost of a major Faction.
A uncolonized planet defended by a faction. They may be hiding something on here from the wider public.
A planet previously used to hide illegal and expensive wares.
A familiar planet, different, yet the same.
A familiar star, different, yet the same.
An object that appears to be a gate, but seemingly one not in line with domain-built specifications.
An abandoned station floating through the system.
A station floating through this system. It is coated in some kind of stealth material to reduce its signal emmisions

A ship from an alternate sector. Despite being designed to be crewed by something, this hull can not support the requirements of a human crew and can only be piloted by processors or AI cores. Due to no records of this ship existing before, your engineers nicknamed it the "Dune-Class". The Dune-Class is a light frigate. It Exceeds in terms of speed, making it a good fill in for any fleet that requires ships that distract from the heavier targets. Those Aspects are only amplified through its "Temporal Shell" Shipsystem, allowing it to quickly send out light-fire and retreat.

A ship from an alternate sector. Despite being designed to be crewed by something, this hull can not support the requirements of a human crew and can only be piloted by processors or AI cores. Due to no records of this ship existing before, your engineers nicknamed it the "Opera-Class". The Opera-Class is a heavy frigate. The Opera-Class manages to unload as many missiles as a destroyer, without loosing the speed of a Frigate. While not as fast as the Dune-Class, its unlikely that its targets can escape from it.

A ship from an alternate sector. Despite being designed to be crewed by something, this hull can not support the requirements of a human crew and can only be piloted by processors or AI cores. Due to no records of this ship existing before, your engineers nicknamed it the "Phenix-Class". The Phenix-Class class comes with a strong set of mounts for its size. Those are enhanced by its shipsystems, which allow it to do large EMP damage to its foes.
Overloads the ships "Energy" type weapons, causing their projectiles to violently release EMPs towards nearby enemies. Does not effect beams.

A processor recovered from chiral remains. While not fully understood by the fleets engineers, it seems compatible with technology of our own, and thus could be used with Automated Ships. The Processor shows no sign of Sentience, but seems to be comparable in terms of power to a gamma-core.

This type of processor appears to make chiral hulls more aggressive.

A processor recovered from chiral remains. While not fully understood by the fleets engineers, it seems compatible with technology of our own, and thus could be used with Automated Ships. The Processor shows no sign of Sentience, but seems to be comparable in terms of power to a gamma-core.

This type of processor appears to make chiral hulls more defensive.

A processor recovered from chiral remains. While not fully understood by the fleets engineers, it seems compatible with technology of our own, and thus could be used with Automated Ships. The Processor shows no sign of Sentience, but seems to be comparable in terms of power to a gamma-core.

This type of processor appears to make chiral hulls do well at offense and defense.

What at first seems to be just a rat, is actually the result of Tri-Tachyon AI Core research. They seem to have managed to integrate a shrunken gamma-core in to a living being and connect it to its brain.
This seems to have given Jeff the required intelligence to become sentient. While he lacks the required organs to talk, he is more than happy to communicate through the comm network, and is according to himself, quite skilled at administrating colonies.
